reviews.review_msg: Hands down my favorite professor at SFU. What a character Ivor is ... eloquent, passionate, and entertaining! Ivor is old school -- be prepared to work hard and don't expect easy marks. If you are willing to learn then I urge you to take one of his classes.

Wanna wake up in the morning? He is sensational and energetic. Simply the most fairest and straight-to-the-point prof I've ever had in 5 years at SFU. To enjoy the class, you better keep up with him. Those who complain are just crybaby slackers who couldn't keep up with his level of competence.
One of the best profs I have had.  He demands a lot, and is a fairly tough marker, but is fair.  You get what you put into the class.  I highly recommend his courses.

This class is by no means a GPA booster.  He's very interested in his work but he demands the same amount of commitment.  Must go to seminars and participate because that's where most of the marks come.  Written marks are generally poor.
A hard marker, but has a genuine interest in the field.
Delicious use of English, every class is filled with wonderful phrases and odd observations.  Always entertaining, his depth of knowledge and passion for what he teaches is refreshing.

An extremely interesting class. To comments below:Taking notes means writing down the main points, not every word that comes out of prof's mouth! Fair and reasonable marker, this has been a gpa booster for me. you will not be bored!

He speed talk in lecture and you'd not be able to write down everything. IF you want to take this class, you need to work really hard. He is a hard and slow marker. I personally have cgpa ~3.00 and this class helped me lower it pretty well.

Ivor is a pretty good lecturer.  Exams were a little tough, some terms seem to come out of nowhere, but overall, his marking was fair.  Ivor was also very flexible on the deadline of assignments.  Also, texts used were interesting.  I had a good time in Geog 300.
